argument.name: timeOut
argument.description: If you don't specify a timeOut, the default value is 300 milliseconds.

argument.name: successFunction
argument.description: The 'successFunction' parameter allows you to pass in an Javascript function to be called once it is determined that the Alpha Anywhere server is available.

argument.name: errorFunction
argument.description: The 'errorFunction' parameter is called if the server is not available.

page.description: Tests if the Alpha Anywhere server is available. This is a more comprehensive test than simply testing if an Internet connection is available.

section.note: Contrast this method with the UX component's ._getOnlineStatus() method. This method merely tests if there is an internet connection. It does not make an ajax callback to the Alpha Anywhere server. Is merely uses the HTML5 navigator.online property. The .serverIsAvailable() method, on the other hand, does a lightweight callback to the Alpha Anywhere server to test if the server is available.

section.title: Discussion
section.description: The function will set these variables in the global A5 Javascript object:
